laboratory_examinations.findings: Patient II:1 had low peak levels of GH during sleep (3.2 ng/ml) and an arginine stimulation test (2.4 ng/ml).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At retesting off GH at 16.6 yr, peak GH levels to arginine and exercise were 5.8 and 2 ng/ml. Further assessment at age 21 yr showed a normal peak GH level of 12.3 ng/ml.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Low IGF-I level at 101 ng/ml (normal range 127â€“360 ng/ml; -3.1 SDS).
GH-E32A produced significantly increased amounts of 17.5-kDa GH isoform (55% of total GH protein) compared with wt-GH.
Normal peak GH level of 12.3 ng/ml.
Height SDS for Patient II:1 was -5.9 showing significant short stature.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient II:1 had catch-up growth initially but subsequently had poor compliance with treatment.
